This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Scam domain report
issue.body:
Здравствуйте!

Домен [https://dumpishop.ru/](https://dumpishop.ru/?ref=10767) является мошенническим и предназначен для выманивания платёжных данных.

К примеру по следующей ссылке:
https://dumpishop.ru/category/keys

Для вашего удобства создал аккаунт:
Логин/пароль: Scamrrrrrr/1234567

Продаются СКАМ ключи к псевдо валютам (скрин 1). После выбора ранодомного «товара» (http://dumpishop.ru/eshop_show/46) предлагается пополнить баланс (скрин 2). После получения ошибки, переходим во вкладку «пополнения баланса» (скрин 3). И выбираем рандомную платёжную систему (скрин 4). После нажатия на кнопку пополнить, мошеннический сайт просит ввести сумму в рублях (скрин 5). Пусть будет 900. После нажатия на кнопку оплаты, попадаем на мошенническую страницу с просьбой перевести деньги на мобильный номер (скрин 6) и текстом «По просьбам наших пользователей, мы отключили стандартный мерчант QIWI и установили способ пополнения "Прямым переводом".»

Скриншоты:

https://i.ibb.co/GtGZGsj/67-F3-A3-AB-DDFF-46-B2-82-E9-024-EB68-C9-EE7.jpg
https://i.ibb.co/ssbSPTz/AB0-C12-E7-EB8-D-49-FE-9-B9-D-D856-BACE7-E82.jpg
https://i.ibb.co/5cqQ95s/CF613593-897-E-4-A85-85-AC-CC67-BA0-FC1-C2.jpg
https://i.ibb.co/3rrpzWK/07-EAA358-4-ACA-49-FD-942-A-7-F0-A61129745.jpg
https://i.ibb.co/CnwZrnF/56-BB80-CE-75-D2-4332-A225-10-EFD0-E4-B115.jpg
https://i.ibb.co/QDt06vc/97658-FC9-BB4-C-4-F4-C-9-B72-F2166-A9-B50-F6.jpg

Прошу принять меры и заблокировать указанный ресурс.

pull_request.title: Fix #123936 webteizle.one
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

Closes #123936



### Add your comment and screenshots

`https://webteizle.one/izle/altyazi/decoys`

<details>

<summary>Screenshot</summary>

![resim](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/108083685/178126410-a2997be7-6012-4232-a679-699fef7d02ef.png)


</details>

---

`/i/*.mp4$domain=webteizle.pro` deleted because it is a duplicate of the rules below.

```
||webteizle.pro/i/*.mp4$media,redirect=noopmp4-1s
||webteizle.*/i/vid-onu-*.mp4$media,redirect=noopmp3-0.1s
```

### Terms

- [x] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

Same.

Please try to disable-enable content blockers in Safari settings and restart Safari, and check for filters update.
Do not close AdGuard window 30-60 seconds, because iOS will breaks configuration process.

comment.body:
Hi. The code `500` in Status tab means that the request was blocked. That's ok.
Just a browser extension blocks request using browser's API, and `standalone app` does it on the network lever.
So when used a browser ad blocker, a request does not leave your browser, and nothing to block by our app. Also the app can block or modify request before it is loaded by a browser(or just cut ad script from the page).

issue.title: www.canalplus.com
issue.body:
# Creating the pull request This PR ensures that video ads never appear on `canalplus.com`. ## Prerequisites ### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms - [X] This is not an ad/bug report; - [X] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project; - [X] I have performed a self-review of my own changes; - [X] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure. ## What problem does the pull request fix? ### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section - [X] Missed ads or ad leftovers;  _(Possibly, in rare instances.)_ - [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly; - [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;  _(Currently undetected but improves/reinforces that side as well.)_ - [ ] Missed analytics or tracker; - [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc; - [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc; - [X] Filters maintenance.  _(Unplanned reorganization included, which should have been done in a separate commit for easier review, sorry about that.)_ ## What issue is being fixed? ### Enter the issue address Fixes #123526, fixes #116568 ### Add your comment and screenshots **_1. Your comment_** Hi. First of all, sorry for the delay. In short, these two issues can _probably_ be explained either by a glitch (see in particular the fact that two instances of AdGuard are used simultaneously on one of the two issues, both of which seem to me to come from the same person by the way) or by the fact that some premium content (coming from their partnership with _6play_ here) would _potentially_ not use `.featPlayerAds`. Although that doesn't seem to be the case. Anyway, the current solution, although never faulty in my tests, is a bit fragile on a glitch level because it must be correctly defined once the DOM of the page is loaded _(document)_ but before its use ~ 2 sec. later in `main.[…].js` _(script)_. Therefore, for the possible rare case where my `set-constant` line wouldn't react fast enough, added: - its `$document,replace=[…]` version (for AG products supporting it); - a deletion of the following JSON content via the `json-prune` scriptlet, where `*` is any ad provider name: - `ads.*.default` _[binary]_ (to allow to never see [that](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4764956/141113868-85bdb3d1-1f24-4ac2-ac20-0000afc560b9.png) in this situation too — English translation: "Advertising: Your content is loading"); - `ads.*.url` _[string]_ (to prevent contacting any ad provider, currently two present, now or later; with `ads.enableAntiAdBlocking` removed alongside); - `ads.enableMidrolls` _[binary]_ (to prevent any possible/future 'OSD' visual stuff showing before trying to show them). The final `, 'ads'` _(another parameter)_ being for optimization purposes: if I understand it correctly, this will allow in this case for each "JSON data" where the `[ROOT].ads` property is absent, to only look for its presence once instead of 3 times. **_2. Screenshots_**
:camera: Screenshot 1 (click to reveal) ![firefox_GMvvbaaA6k](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4764956/177807367-266b69b5-7ada-45aa-8920-582eb4737d1b.png) **Source:** `https://player.canalplus.com/one/configs/v2/10/mycanal/prod.json` _(**OnePlayer** is the name of their player)_ … but will also works on all variants visible here (`https://player.canalplus.com/one/configs/v2/10/mapping/mapping.json`), e.g.: - `https://player.canalplus.com/one/configs/v2/10/mycanalch/prod.json` - `https://player.canalplus.com/one/configs/v2/10/orange/prod.json` - `https://player.canalplus.com/one/configs/v2/10/piwi/prod.json` (for kids, where we can see that `ads.enableMidrolls` is already `false` there for example) - etc. :bulb: And if you are wondering: `params.enableAd`, either removed or set to `false` via a `$replace` rule, has no influence on _video ads_.
:camera: Screenshot 2 (click to reveal) ![firefox_ne8QfUSCNC](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4764956/177807419-4a8fff2d-fe28-47f9-862d-0ea400a88f3b.png) _:information_source: If `json-prune` only used, production of this error but does not pose any problem (same result with an adequate **`redirect`** rule [noopvmap-1.0](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/Scriptlets/blob/master/wiki/about-redirects.md#noopvmap-1.0) on `proxy.ads.canalplus-bo.net/[…]` for example, by the way)._
### Terms - [X] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
@contribucious Ok, added
`||proxy.ads.canalplus-bo.net/web/*/advert/?adInfo=$xmlhttprequest,other,redirect=noopvmap-1.0,domain=canalplus.com,important`

comment.body:
> This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity. Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs. Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

Where can I find the Updated Dynamics? aff.php?

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;

- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;

comment.body:
If I'm not wrong, all other similar sections (these with `Purpose:  [...]`) do not start with capital letter (I mean capital letter in a `Blocks` word).
So, maybe it would be better to be consistent and use a small letter too?

comment.body:
For apps(cannot check in Firefox)
`||static.cdninstagram.com/rsrc.php/$replace=/"PolarisSponsorsUnit"\,//`

For extensions, but for russian lang only(cannot change site's language)
`instagram.com#$?#main > section div[style^="flex-direction: column;"] > article > div:has(span:contains(Спонсор публикации:)) { visibility: hidden !important; }`

`instagram.com#?#main > section div[style^="flex-direction: column;"] > article > div:has(span:contains(Спонсор публикации:))`
Two rules, because there is a scrilling issue, when a parent element of promoted post is hidden or removed.

@AdguardTeam/filters-maintainers Please take a look.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -91,8 +91,30 @@ General requirements for submitting rules: don't add rules to the beginning of t
 
 ### AdGuard Annoyances filter
 
-* Purpose: this filter blocks various kinds of annoyances from sites.
-* [Annoyances folder](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/tree/master/AnnoyancesFilter/sections)
+* Purpose: Blocks irritating elements on web pages including cookie notices, third-party widgets and in-page pop-ups.
+* [Annoyances folder](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/tree/master/AnnoyancesFilter)
+
+   Contains the following AdGuard filters: Cookie Notices, Popups, Mobile App Banners, Other Annoyances and Widgets:
+
+   - ### Cookie Notices
+      * Purpose: this filter blocks cookie notices on web pages.
+      * [Cookies folder](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/tree/master/AnnoyancesFilter/Cookies/sections)
+
+   - ### Mobile App Banners
+      * Purpose: this filter blocks irritating banners that promote mobile apps of websites.
+      * [MobileApp folder](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/tree/master/AnnoyancesFilter/MobileApp/sections)
+
+   - ### Popups
+      * Purpose: this filter blocks all kinds of pop-ups that are not necessary for websites operation.
+      * [Popups folder](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/tree/master/AnnoyancesFilter/Popups/sections)
+
+   - ### Widgets
+      * Purpose: this filter blocks annoying third-party widgets: online assistants, live support chats, etc.
comment.body:
Two `:` - maybe better 
```suggestion
      * Purpose: this filter blocks annoying third-party widgets - online assistants, live support chats, etc.
```

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 10 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
@iqddd У вас стабильно повторяется? У себя проверяю - со всеми Адгардами вложение открывается.

Можете проделать следующее?
- отключите все опции антитрекинга, кроме ломающей
- отключите фильтры(они же не влияют?)
- откройте журнал фильтрации(в меню в трее -> Дополнительно)
- повторите проблему и экспортируйте журнал
- отправьте файл на filters@adguard.com

labels.name: Extra
labels.description: Issues, related to AdGuard Extra extension

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
Включите расширение AdGuard Extra в настройках программы.

---

Пользователям браузерного расширения нужно установить скрипт `AdGuard Extra`. Для этого понадобится браузерное расширение-скриптоприёмник `Tampermonkey`

Ссылка на `AdGuard Extra`
https://userscripts.adtidy.org/beta/adguard-extra/1.0/adguard-extra.user.js

После установки скрипта нужно будет зайти в настройки `Tampermonkey`, включить режим эксперта, переключить режим встраивания на `мгновенный` и перезапустить расширение:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641343-07248e00-b94c-11e9-9775-9854a7922889.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8361299/62641299-f7a54500-b94b-11e9-8a83-885d89abbeec.png)

issue.title: ilikecomix.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [NSFW] [https://ilikecomix.com/xxx_comics/](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Filikecomix.com%2Fxxx_comics%2F) ### Comment > Clicking on any link to a chapter of images or at the bottom to the next page. The active tab will open the ad syndication.realsrv.com/splash.php and then open the correct link in a new tab. It will do it only twice then work correctly. By clearing cookies and or cache the problem will happen again. It works fine if everything is opened in a new tab in the first place though. Also the problem only happens when using it in firefox. Chrome with adguard extension works correctly already. ### [NSFW] Screenshots

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

Там используется DRM, сложный вариант и HAR не особо поможет.

`||atv-ps.amazon.com/cdp/catalog/GetPlaybackResources?$removeheader=deviceAdInsertionTypeOverride`
или
```
||atv-ps.amazon.com/cdp/catalog/GetPlaybackResources?$removeheader=deviceAdInsertionTypeOverride
||atv-ps.amazon.com/cdp/catalog/GetPlaybackResources?$removeheader=deviceDrmOverride
```

issue.title: www.canalplus.com
issue.body:
# Creating the pull request This PR ensures that video ads never appear on `canalplus.com`. ## Prerequisites ### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms - [X] This is not an ad/bug report; - [X] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project; - [X] I have performed a self-review of my own changes; - [X] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure. ## What problem does the pull request fix? ### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section - [X] Missed ads or ad leftovers;  _(Possibly, in rare instances.)_ - [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly; - [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;  _(Currently undetected but improves/reinforces that side as well.)_ - [ ] Missed analytics or tracker; - [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc; - [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc; - [X] Filters maintenance.  _(Unplanned reorganization included, which should have been done in a separate commit for easier review, sorry about that.)_ ## What issue is being fixed? ### Enter the issue address Fixes #123526, fixes #116568 ### Add your comment and screenshots **_1. Your comment_** Hi. First of all, sorry for the delay. In short, these two issues can _probably_ be explained either by a glitch (see in particular the fact that two instances of AdGuard are used simultaneously on one of the two issues, both of which seem to me to come from the same person by the way) or by the fact that some premium content (coming from their partnership with _6play_ here) would _potentially_ not use `.featPlayerAds`. Although that doesn't seem to be the case. Anyway, the current solution, although never faulty in my tests, is a bit fragile on a glitch level because it must be correctly defined once the DOM of the page is loaded _(document)_ but before its use ~ 2 sec. later in `main.[…].js` _(script)_. Therefore, for the possible rare case where my `set-constant` line wouldn't react fast enough, added: - its `$document,replace=[…]` version (for AG products supporting it); - a deletion of the following JSON content via the `json-prune` scriptlet, where `*` is any ad provider name: - `ads.*.default` _[binary]_ (to allow to never see [that](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4764956/141113868-85bdb3d1-1f24-4ac2-ac20-0000afc560b9.png) in this situation too — English translation: "Advertising: Your content is loading"); - `ads.*.url` _[string]_ (to prevent contacting any ad provider, currently two present, now or later; with `ads.enableAntiAdBlocking` removed alongside); - `ads.enableMidrolls` _[binary]_ (to prevent any possible/future 'OSD' visual stuff showing before trying to show them). The final `, 'ads'` _(another parameter)_ being for optimization purposes: if I understand it correctly, this will allow in this case for each "JSON data" where the `[ROOT].ads` property is absent, to only look for its presence once instead of 3 times. **_2. Screenshots_**
:camera: Screenshot 1 (click to reveal) ![firefox_GMvvbaaA6k](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4764956/177807367-266b69b5-7ada-45aa-8920-582eb4737d1b.png) **Source:** `https://player.canalplus.com/one/configs/v2/10/mycanal/prod.json` _(**OnePlayer** is the name of their player)_ … but will also works on all variants visible here (`https://player.canalplus.com/one/configs/v2/10/mapping/mapping.json`), e.g.: - `https://player.canalplus.com/one/configs/v2/10/mycanalch/prod.json` - `https://player.canalplus.com/one/configs/v2/10/orange/prod.json` - `https://player.canalplus.com/one/configs/v2/10/piwi/prod.json` (for kids, where we can see that `ads.enableMidrolls` is already `false` there for example) - etc. :bulb: And if you are wondering: `params.enableAd`, either removed or set to `false` via a `$replace` rule, has no influence on _video ads_.
:camera: Screenshot 2 (click to reveal) ![firefox_ne8QfUSCNC](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4764956/177807419-4a8fff2d-fe28-47f9-862d-0ea400a88f3b.png) _:information_source: If `json-prune` only used, production of this error but does not pose any problem (same result with an adequate **`redirect`** rule [noopvmap-1.0](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/Scriptlets/blob/master/wiki/about-redirects.md#noopvmap-1.0) on `proxy.ads.canalplus-bo.net/[…]` for example, by the way)._
### Terms - [X] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met

comment.body:
@Alex-302 Sorry, I misspoke. It was not clear.

This was following a correction in the "Screenshot 2" section (since corrected). And that was just a rule used in my local tests (_a useless rule_ thanks to the `json-prune` system [… `ads.*.url` …] which prevents this request from being made — scriptlet which is supported by more products than `$redirect`).

:arrow_right_hook: In fact, rule reported just to say that, versus the **used** `json-prune` system, this alternative method also produced the same _non-problematic_ error visible in _Firefox Developer Tools_ on this second screenshot so that it was OK/normal and not to worry about it.

:heavy_check_mark: But **we can leave it however now**, it will serve as an interesting fallback to the `json-prune` system (if they ever change the name of their JSON properties one day). :thumbsup: :wink:

comment.body: Hello! Unfortunately, in this version of the site we can't block ads due to the fact that in the amp version the extension can't get to elements inside the shadow dom. You can try to remove `/amp` from the url or install an [extension](https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/amp2html/) that will redirect the amp version to the full version of the website.

comment.body:
Unfortunately, I cannot reproduce too using 'simple email signup'.
I think that it is caused by a 3rd-party anti-virus software or browser extension.
If HTTPS scanning of a 3rd-party anti-virus software is enabled, please disable it.

But, I will check again.

<details>
<summary>Screenshot</summary>

pull_request.title: Fix #124014 dizimax.plus
pull_request.body:
# Creating the pull request

> Please include a summary of the change and which issue is fixed\
> If the related issue does not exist in our repository, please create it before making pull request\
> It is highly recommended to use our [Web Reporting Tool](https://kb.adguard.com/en/technical-support/reporting-tool) instead of creating an issue on GitHub directly\
> Please note, that we verify every pull request manually, so it may take time to apply it

## Prerequisites

### To avoid invalid pull requests, please check and confirm following terms

- [x] This is not an ad/bug report;
- [x] My code follows the [guidelines](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) and [syntax](https://kb.adguard.com/general/how-to-create-your-own-ad-filters) of this project;
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own changes;
- [x] My changes do not break web sites, apps and files structure.

## What problem does the pull request fix?

### If the problem does not fall under any category that is listed here, please write a comment below in corresponding section

- [ ] Missed ads or ad leftovers;
- [ ] Website or app doesn't work properly;
- [ ] AdGuard gets detected on a website;
- [ ] Missed analytics or tracker;
- [ ] Social media buttons — share, like, tweet, etc;
- [ ] Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc;
- [x] Filters maintenance.

## What issue is being fixed?

### Enter the issue address

Closes #124014

### Add your comment and screenshots

`https://dizimax.plus/`

<details>

<summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![resim](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/108083685/178180507-9fa960a3-30e5-4e3e-ae08-661a54309e57.png)


</details>





### Terms

- [ ] By submitting this issue, I agree that pull request does not contain private info and all conditions are met
